intro: Pauletia depauperata, commonly known as the poorflower, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its delicate, pale pink to white flowers that bloom in late summer. Pauletia depauperata is typically found in rocky or disturbed soils at high altitudes. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
